Microsoft.details: Founded in 1975, Microsoft entered the operating system business with Xenix, MS-DOS, and Windows.

Nokia.details: In November 1992, the Nokia 1011 launched, making it the first commercially available GSM mobile phone.

Apple.details: Apple initially made computers and operating systems.

IBM.details: IBM is a pioneer in making mainframe computers and made operating systems early on.

details: Established in 1889, Nintende has origin as a playing card business. in early 1990s, it started making Game Boy and Super Nintendo Entertainment System gaming consoles.

Samsung.details: amsung was founded in 1938 as a trading company and entered the electronics industry in 1960s. In 1990, it made mobile phones and semiconductors that became its most important source of income.

Sega.details: Sega released consoles named Genesis and Sega Saturn. It also launched a popular game Sonic the Hedgehog.

Sony.details: In 1994, Sopny launched Playstation gaming console. It also developed and released games for its consoles.

Microsoft.details: Released Windows 95 and 98. Microsoft launched a dedicated search engine called MSN Search in 1999.

Nokia.details: In October 1998, Nokia overtook Motorola to become the best-selling mobile phone brand,[39] and in December manufactured its 100 millionth mobile phone. Also co-founded Psion and made mobile OS.

Apple.details: Apple developed Pippin, an open multimedia technology platform. In partnership with Bandai, they launched Pippin models as game consoles. In 1997, production of the Pippin was canceled.

Red Hat Inc..details: Red Hat went public on August 11, 1999.

Skype.details: Skype was established in 2003 for peer-to-peer communication.

LinkedIn.details: The company was founded in December 2002 by Reid Hoffman and the founding team members from PayPal and Socialnet.com.

Nokia.details: Between 1996 and 2001, Nokia's turnover increased fivefold, from €6.5 billion to €31 billion. In 2002, Nokia released N-Gage, combining features of a mobile phone and handheld game console.

Facebook.details: Founded in 2004, as a social networking platform.

Baidu.details: Baidu was incorporated on January 18, 200. In 2003, Baidu launched a news search engine and picture search engine, adopting a special identification technology capable of identifying and grouping the articles. Also launched Baidu Tieba, an online forum based community networking service.

Sega.details: In 2003, Sammy first bought 22.4% shares of Sega and later acquired the remaining shares, completing a takeover, resulting in Sega Sammy Holdings.

Sony.details: In 2001, Sony entered into a joint venture with Swedish telecommunications company Ericsson, forming Sony Ericsson Mobile Communications. It also launched Linux for PlayStation 2 operating system for its console.

Qwant.details: Qwant is a French search engine, launched in February 2013 and operated from Paris. It is one of the few EU-based search engines. It claims that it does not employ user tracking or personalize search results in order to avoid trapping users in a filter bubble.

Flipkart.details: Binny Bansal and Sachin Bansal, who met in 2005 at IIT-Delhi, launch an internet business called Flipkart — an online bookstore that promised to deliver anywhere in India.

Skype.details: In 2005, ebay acquired Skype. Then, in 2009, Silver Lake, Andreessen Horowitz, and the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board bought 65% of Skype for $1.9 billion from eBay.

Microsoft.details: In 2009, Microsoft launches Bing web search engine.

LinkedIn.details: In June 2008, Sequoia Capital, Greylock Partners, and other venture capital firms purchased a 5% stake in the company for $53 million, giving the company a post-money valuation of approximately $1 billion.

Nokia.details: In 2005, Nokia developed a Linux-based operating system called Maemo, which shipped that year on the Nokia 770 Internet Tablet.

Facebook.details: Facebook tests instant messaging feature (Facebook Chat).

WhatsApp.details: WhatsApp was founded in February 2009 and released a mobile phone app for instant messaging and sharing photos.

Baidu.details: Baidu Space, a social networking service was launched in 2006.

Duck Duck Go Inc..details: Founded in 2008, DuckDuckGo (DDG) is an internet search engine that emphasizes protecting searchers' privacy and avoiding the filter bubble of personalized search results.

Nintendo.details: Made an operating system named Nintendo DSi system software from 2008 - 2012.

Red Hat Inc..details: On March 15, 2007, Red Hat released Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, and in June acquired Mobicents.

ZAPiT Games Inc..details: In 2005, ZAPiT launched the Game Wave Family Entertainment System, commonly abbreviated as Game Wave, is a hybrid DVD player and home video game console.

Zeebo Inc..details: The Zeebo console is a 3G-enabled entertainment and education system from Zeebo Inc. It enabled users to play video games, and also connect to the Internet, communicate online and run educational applications.

Walmart.details: Walmart acquires 51% stake in Yihaodian, an e-commerce business in China.

Flipkart.details: In 2010, Flipkart pioneers the Cash-on-Delivery payment mode, introduces a 30-day return policy and acquires the social book recommendation portal WeRead.

Skype.details: In May 2011, Microsoft bought Skype for $8.5 billion and used it to replace their Windows Live Messenger.

Microsoft.details: Microsoft acquired Skype in 2011. Upgrades Kinect for Xbox One. In 2013, Microsoft buys enterprise social network service Yammer. In 2013, Microsoft buys Nokia.

LinkedIn.details: In 2011 LinkedIn earned $154.6 million in advertising revenue alone, surpassing Twitter, which earned $139.5 million.

Nokia.details: Nokia discontinues production of N-Gage. On 11 February 2011, Nokia announced a strategic partnership with Microsoft. Released Nokia X which ran on a customized version of Android.

WhatsApp.details: WhatsApp announces new encryption software and introduces voice message feature.

Instagram.details: Established in 2010, Instagram was a photo and video sharing social media platform.

Apple.details: In 2010, Apple introduced iTunes Ping, a music-oriented social networking service. It was discontinued in 2012.

Baidu.details: In 2014, Baidu announced acquisition of Brazilian local e-commerce site Peixe Urbano. Baidu Yi, an opeerating system for mobile devices was launched in 2011.

Google.details: Google acquired Quiksee, who specialized interactive and immersive media experiences, including games. In 2011, Google acquired Motorola Mobility. Releases Nexus mobile phone. Launched Google+.

Nintendo.details: In 2011, launched Nintendo 3DS system software an updatable operating system used by the Nintendo 3DS.

Red Hat Inc..details: In 2012, Red Hat became the first one-billion dollar open-source company, reaching US$1.13 billion in annual revenue during its fiscal year.

Samsung.details: Tizen is a Linux-based mobile operating system backed by the Linux Foundation, mainly developed and used primarily by Samsung Electronics.

Sony.details: In 2013, Sony launched an operating system, Orbis OS, for PlayStation 4.

ZAPiT Games Inc..details: ZAPiT released last game called Quiz Konnect in 2010. No information of publishing games or game console after 2010 was found.

Zeebo Inc..details: In June 2010, in advance of the World Cup, Zeebo released the first of its Football Club titles, Zeebo F.C. Foot Camp, developed by Zeebo Interactive Studios in Brazil. The Zeebo console was discontinued in 2011.

Walmart.details: Walmart acquires 100% stake in Yihaodian, an e-commerce business in China, up from the 51% stake since 2012. Online retailer Jet.com and Heyneedle, a subsidiary of Jet.com, become part of the Walmart family.

Flipkart.details: In 2014, Flipkart introduces Same Day Delivery Guarantee. In 2018, Walmart becomes the largest shareholder in Flipkart.

Skype.details: In 2017, Skype changed from a peer-to-peer service to a centralized Azure-based service.

Microsoft.details: Microsoft bought LinkedIn in 2016 for $26.2  billion.

LinkedIn.details: In February 2016 following an earnings report, LinkedIn's shares dropped 43.6% within a single day, down to $108.38 per share. LinkedIn lost $10 billion of its market capitalization that day. In June 2016, Microsoft announced that it would acquire LinkedIn for $196 a share, a total value of $26.2 billion.

Nokia.details: After selling its mobile and devices division to Microsoft, Nokia  network equipment (e.g., telecommunication) through Nokia Networks. It bought French telecommunications equipment company Alcatel-Lucent in 2016.

Facebook.details: Facebook acquired Oculus VR Inc and used the VR headset, among others, as hardware for playing games. In 2019, it acquired popular VR game developer Beat Games. Made hidden games in Facebook Messenger.

WhatsApp.details: Launched WhatsApp Web in 2015 and a feature for sending documents in 2016.

Instagram.details: In December 2016, Instagram announced that it has over 600 million monthly active users.

Apple.details: In 2019, Apple launced a video game subscription service called Apple Arcade.

Baidu.details: Baidu Yi operating system was discontinued in March 2015.

Google.details: In 2019, Google acquired Typhoon Studios, an independent game development studio.

Nintendo.details: Nintendo Switch system software was released as an operating system for Nintendo Switch in 2017.

Red Hat Inc..details: In May 2018, Red Hat acquired CoreOS.

Sega.details: Did not make gaming consoles after 2011.

Walmart.details: Walmart sells majority stake in Seiyu to KKR and Rakuten. Walmart scales InHome Delivery reaching 30 million U.S. homes.

Skype.details: As of March 2020, Skype was used by 100 million people at least once a month and by 40 million people each day.

Microsoft.details: In 2022, Microsoft announced plans to acquire Activision Blizzard.

LinkedIn.details: As of February 2022, LinkedIn has 830+ million registered members from over 200 countries and territories.

Nokia.details: Nokia acquires Elenion Technologies to expand its market footprint by addressing the critical and rapidly evolving optical connectivity requirements of 5G, cloud and enterprise networking.

Facebook.details: Facebook continues launching improved VR headsets. Releases Horizon Worlds, a free VR online video game in 2021.

WhatsApp.details: Introduced WhatsApp Payments (marketed as WhatsApp Pay), which is a peer-to-peer money transfer feature that is currently only available in India.

interactions.details: Walmart acquires 51% stake in Yihaodian, an e-commerce business in China.
Walmart acquires 100% stake in Yihaodian, an e-commerce business in China, up from the 51% stake since 2012.
Online retailer Jet.com and Heyneedle, a subsidiary of Jet.com, become part of the Walmart family.
Walmart bought a controlling stake in Flipkart in 2018 for $16 billion.
Walmart sells majority stake in Seiyu to KKR and Rakuten.
eBay Inc. acquired Skype in 2005 for $2.6 billion

In May 2011, all of the equity in Skype was sold to Microsoft for $8.5 billion. Due to eBay’s 30% stake at the time of sale, the company realized a net gain of $1.4 billion on its original investment in Skype.

Flipkart and eBay entered into a strategic partnership in 2017 under which eBay Inc acquired a 5.44% stake in Flipkart in exchange for its eBay India business for $211 Mn and a $514 Mn cash investment

We purchase PayPal, unifying the web’s largest marketplace and an innovative system for secure and hassle-free payment. Being part of eBay Inc. for more than a decade enabled PayPal's strong growth and global leadership position in digital payments. Together, PayPal and eBay’s strong synergies benefit both businesses for years. PayPal is spun off 13 years later into an independent company in July 2015.
eBay and PayPal announce plans to become independent companies in 2015, enabling both to sharpen their strategic focus and hone in on innovative growth opportunities in their respective markets.

Microsoft purchased Skype for $8.5 billion, deepening the company’s longstanding focus on real-time video and voice communications, and providing new market opportunities serving Skype’s 160-plus million active users.
Microsoft acquired GitHub, a popular code-repository service used by many developers and large companies, for $7.5 billion in stock.
Microsoft’s $26.2-billion acquisition of LinkedIn aimed to grow the professional networking site and integrate it with Microsoft’s enterprise software, such as Office 365.
In 2014 Nokia sold its mobile and devices division to Microsoft.

Facebook announced today that it has reached an agreement to acquire Instagram, a fun, popular photo-sharing app for mobile devices. The total consideration for San Francisco-based Instagram is approximately $1 billion in a combination of cash and shares of Facebook.

February 19, 2014 – Facebook today announced that it has reached a definitive agreement to acquire WhatsApp, a rapidly growing cross-platform mobile messaging company, for a total of approximately $16 billion, including $4 billion in cash and approximately $12 billion worth of Facebook shares
IBM Closes Landmark Acquisition of Red Hat for $34 Billion
Samsung to acquire all of Sony's shares of S-LCD, making the joint venture its wholly-owned subsidiary. Sony and Samsung enter into a strategic agreement for supply and purchase of LCD panels.
Sega and Microsoft Team Up for Strategic Xbox Alliance. Sega to make 11 games for Microsoft Xbox console.
SEGA and Microsoft to Explore Strategic Alliance to create New Strategic Titles for SEGA and establish a Next-Generation Development Environment.
Microsoft to acquire Activision Blizzard to bring the joy and community of gaming to everyone, across every device
In June 2019, Qwant announced a partnership with Microsoft to use the Microsoft Azure cloud services to power its own crawlers and algorithms, while preserving the user's privacy.
In June 1998, Psion Software became Symbian Ltd., a major joint venture between Psion and phone manufacturers Ericsson, Motorola, and Nokia.
Microsoft bought $240 million equity stake in Facebook’s next round of financing at a $15 billion valuation.
Facebook partners with Skype to add video chat.
Facebook partners with Microsoft to use Bing for web search results.
In 2013, Facebook partners with Microsoft's Bing and integrates its new search product Graph Search for semantic search.
Facebook bought WhatsApp for a total of approx. $16 billion.
In 2012, Facebook acquired Instagram for $1 billion.
In 2019, Apple partnered with noted game developers (e.g., Sega, Annapurna Interactive, etc.) to make games for Apple Arcade.
Microsoft invested $150 million in Apple stock. They partered to build Microsoft tools (e.g., Office) for Mac platform and to make Internet Explorer a default browser in Mac OS.
The AIM alliance was formed on Oct 2, 1991. It was intended to solve legacy problems, future-proof the industry, and compete with Microsoft's monopoly and the Wintel duopoly.
Sony and Nintendo partnered to make the Super NES CD-ROM System, a video game console. But the agreement was cancelled which lead Sony to develop its PlayStation console.
In 1999, IBM and Nintendo today announced a multi-year $1 billion technology agreement to support Nintendo's next home video game console, code-named Dolphin.
IBM, Compaq, others buy minority stake in Red Hat.
IBM acquires Red Hat for $34 Billion. IBM preserves Red Hat’s independence and neutrality; Red Hat will strengthen its existing partnerships to give customers freedom, choice and flexibility.

Qwant and Microsoft announce an exclusive partnership. Microsoft will provide additional computing power of its Azure Cloud to meet the growing needs of the European market, with Microsoft Advertising services and Bing’s algorithmic research. Meanwhile,  Qwant remains in control of its technology, including its algorithm, index and client infrastructure, without collecting personal data, to better secure the privacy of its users and the confidentiality of their research.
On 24 August 2012, nine American jurors ruled that Samsung Electronics had to pay Apple $1.05 billion in damages for violating six of its patents on smartphone technology.

In 2022, Samsung Electronics announced an expanded partnership with Google. Samsung Galaxy phone and tablet users will be able to easily onboard Matter-compatible devices to both the SmartThings and Google Home ecosystems.
